revised_title: Exploration and Scientific Observations on the Western Coast of North America
tldr: The late Mr. Douglas undertook an expedition to explore and collect plants from the western coast of North America, from California to the Rocky Mountains. He made various scientific observations, including geographical, magnetical, and meteorological measurements. Unfortunately, he lost most of his collections and papers in a canoe accident. Major Edward Sabine later reported on Douglas's work and shared the preserved books and observations.
